SEARCH
Package org.ddolib.modeling

Interface Problem<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of state
All Known Implementing Classes:
ALPProblem, BKSProblem, GRProblem, KSProblem, LCSProblem, Max2SatProblem, MCPProblem, MispProblem, MSCTProblem, PDPProblem, PSProblem, SMICProblem, SRFLPProblem, TSPProblem, TSProblem, TSPTWProblem
public interface Problem<T>
This is the definition of the problem one tries to optimize. It basically consists of a problem's formulation in terms of the labeled transition system semantics of a dynamic programme.

  • Method Details

    • nbVars

      int nbVars()
      Returns:
      the number of variables in the problem

    • initialState

      T initialState()
      Returns:
      the intial state of the problem

    • initialValue

      double initialValue()
      Returns:
      the problem's initial value

    • domain

      Iterator<Integer> domain(T state, int var)
      Parameters:
      state - the state from which the transitions should be applicable
      var - the variable whose domain in being queried
      Returns:
      all values in the domain of `var` if a decision is made about the given variable

    • transition

      T transition(T state, Decision decision)
      Applies the problem transition function from one state to the next going through a given decision. (Computes the next state)
      Parameters:
      state - the state from which the transition originates
      decision - the decision which is applied to `state`.

    • transitionCost

      double transitionCost(T state, Decision decision)
      Computes the impact on the objective value of making the given decision in the specified state.
      Parameters:
      state - the state from which the transition originates.
      decision - the decision which is applied to `state`.

    • optimalValue

      default Optional<Double> optimalValue()
      Returns the expected optimal value if known.

      WARNING: It must return the expected value returned by the solver. Be cautious if you are working with a minimization problem and negative number.

      Returns:
      the expected optimal value if known.
